title: Palmar
description: From the team behind Alter, Palmar is a casual Chinese restaurant in Wynwood that focuses on the country's diverse cuisine. The menu includes a wide range of options for all appetites and palates, from snacks, rices, and noodles, to large formats such as

title: CHARCOAL garden bar + grill
description: Ken Lyon, a veteran player in Miami’s restaurant and catering industry, is behind this eating establishment at The Wynwood Yard, an entrepreneurial community hub that has gained national recognition. Housed within several modified shipping containers, Cha

title: Beaker and Gray
description: Conceptualized by chef/owner Brian Nasajon and bar manager/owner Ben Potts, Beaker & Gray is a 120-seat eatery with an inventive, playful, globally-inspired menu and a vibrant bar scene. Named after two elemental culinary tools — the Beaker, used by barte

title: GKB
description: Chef Rafael Perez (ex Little Palm Island Resort & Spa) draws inspiration from his native Peru and worldly culinary experiences at this Wynwood hot spot, offering unique riffs on tiraditos, ceviches and mains like cornish hen with Peruvian potato puree, pl

title: Alter
description: Alter is a casual, chef-driven American restaurant located in Miami's Wynwood neighborhood. Helmed by chef Bradley Kilgore, the kitchen produces seasonal cuisine focused on locally sourced ingredients, highlighting Florida's rich seafood, fruits, vegetabl

title: Seaspice
description: Né Sea Salt & Pepper, Seaspice is is perched on the Miami River, a repurposed industrial warehouse space combined with outside seating on the dock. The downtown skyline views are beautiful, yes, though perhaps less so than the people about the dining room

title: Modern Garden
description: A mini-restaurant within Seaspice (or the antidote to Seaspice, depending on how you see things), Modern Garden serves primarily crudo and hot stone cooked meats. "Quaint and intimate, Modern Garden looks like an origami orchard," says the Miami New Times

title: ARSON
description: At the helm of ARSON is a chef, Deme Lomas, that's fixated by flames. This is nothing to be afraid of, rather — there's a lot to be excited about. Outfitted with a Josper oven-grill hybrid, the kitchen turns out boldly flavorful Euro-Asian fare with a foc

title: Perricone's Marketplace & Cafe
description: A quintessential Italian joint, Perricone's Marketplace & Cafe sits in a quiet park nestled in the shadows of the skyscrapers lining Brickell Avenue. With menu specialties like garganelli carbonara and veal parmiagiana, an authentically rustic environment

title: Eating House
description: Eating House is a spunky, yet laid back American restaurant offering tasty, innovate fare. Known for cap'n crunch pancakes at brunch, and very good carbonara (in mac n' cheese form at lunch, and a more traditional style at dinner), it's a fun, casual spot

title: Swine
description: Among other things on offer is what the Miami New Times and Travel + Leisure both call one of the best burgers in Miami. Pork things are the main show here, of course, but the menu has evolved to also include plenty of lighter fare, like seared salmon and

title: The Local Craft Food & Drink
description: With an ever changing menu to keep the inventive Chef from getting bored, “The Local” is a quaint local’s spot in the heart of Coral Gables, FL with a charming cult following. With scratch cooking as this kitchen’s base, Chef Bryant has started rethinking

title: Greenstreet Cafe
description: Half of Greenstreet’s appeal is the great brunch offerings. The other half is the people-watching. Owner Silvano Bignon opened the Coconut Grove café 30 years ago, launching Miami’s premier “seen or be seen” restaurant. The sidewalk patio is the most cove

title: Lulu in the Grove
description: A funky neighborhood joint and outdoor sidewalk locale, Lulu in the Grove is deeply invested in serving fresh, organic, and local ingredients to Coconut Grove. Here, everything is made in-house, from mustard and smoked salmon to pastries and even the infu

title: The River Oyster Bar
description: The River Oyster Bar is a local favorite for good reason. Beyond a varied selection of oysters from both coasts (which are offered for $1.50 a pop during happy hour), the menu features mainly seafood-based fare, like coconut steamed mussels, a Maine lobst

title: The Local House
description: The Local House is the kind of place you want to linger in, long after the meal is done. Enjoy eclectic culinary creations in a setting that exudes warmth.

title: Ofa Restaurant
description: Celebrating its namesake Farofa – the typical Brazilian side dish made of toasted yucca flour and spices – Ofa offers a menu of progressive Brazilian cuisine, rooted in tradition and simultaneously representative of the country’s rich, contemporary gastro

title: Drunken Dragon
description: The critics use adjectives like "hot," "sexy," "sizzling," and "exotic" when they try to describe Drunken Dragon. But, alas, like many of the punk rock Asian restaurants that have lit a fire under the dining scenes of places like New York and Los Angeles,

title: Il Mulino
description: From Eater: "Il Mulino New York, the classic Italian eatery with locations all over the world, has brought its talents to South Beach.  The restaurant ... will offer guests a modern interior feel, inspired by its Art Deco surroundings and the 'unique Miam

title: Monty's Sunset
description: Located poolside and waterfront on the docks of the picturesque Miami Beach Marina, Monty’s Sunset is South Beach’s premiere spot for casual dining, fresh-caught local seafood, a succulent raw bar, live music and the most stunning sunsets in South Florida

title: The Grill at Bal Harbour
description: Since 1977, Hillstone has created restaurants that seek to enliven the senses through inspired settings, graceful service, and cuisine that simply tastes delicious. Each of our restaurants complements the unique character of its locale, seeking to be a pl

title: Two Chefs Restaurant
description: Two Chefs Restaurant, a leader on the culinary scene of South Florida. Two Chefs widely celebrated cuisine is unique - embodying an elegant restraint and a purity of ingredients seasoned with years of "know how" that charms the palate. The restaurants int

title: Mina's Mediterraneo
description: Mina’s Mediterreano brings a variety of Middle Eastern eats to Miami’s Upper East Side. Dishes take influence from various cuisines — including but not limited to Egyptian, Greek, Italian, and Spanish. A solid happy hour and patio dining are added bonuses

title: Vagabond Kitchen and Bar
description: "The Vagabond Restaurant & Bar features a "casual fine dining" menu filled with American, Latin and Asain influences inspired by Executive Chef Alex Chang's world travels. The 25-year-old, self-taught chef has spent the past few years doing stints at nota

title: Lure Fishbar MIA
description: The front-men at Lure are John McDonald and chef Josh Capon and the loose conceit here is that you're on their good-times yacht. Just like when you're on a private boat, the menu is basically whatever you can think of, from excellent sushi to pro steaks.

title: Byblos
description: Middleterranean cuisine gains traction with the arrival of this eye-catching eatery, an offshoot of the Toronto original set in the Shorecrest tower of The Royal Palm South Beach Hotel offering unique takes on Levantine meze and exotically spiced lamb, du

title: Hillstone Coral Gables
description: Situated prominently at the corner of Ponce De Leon and Coral Way known as the 'Miracle Mile', Hillstone has been an essential stop for locals and visitors for nearly 15 years. Among the favorites: ahi tuna tartare with sliced avocado, handcrafted sushi,
